title: MLB rumors: Why Yankees love Jeff Samardzija, per report
text:
Comments 
Apparently the Yankees are infatuated with soon-to-be free agent right-hander Jeff Samardzija. 
There are several reasons the Yankees are all about the 30-year-old who underperformed with the White Sox this season â€” and not just because special assistant Jim Hendry drafted him out of college when he was the Cubs' general manager. 
From CBS Sports' Jon Heyman : 
Some Yankees people love Samardzija for his potential, and also for his interest in the big stage. That Samardzija was a star wide receiver for Notre Dame adds to the interest for the Yankees, who see better results ahead for Samardzija. They also may see a possible bargain following a year in which he had a near-5 ERA, totally uncharacteristic for him. The Yankees will almost definitely have to surrender a top pick if they sign the former Notre Dame tight end, since it's nearly a lock that Chicago will give him the qualifying offer. 
The Yankees no longer appear sure they have an ace in righty Masahiro Tanaka, and health and injury concerns still surround pitchers they expect to return, such as Ivan Nova, Michael Pineda and CC Sabathia.
